intro: Allocarya charaxata, commonly known as the mountain dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Allocarya charaxata plays a vital role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various herbivores.
